channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023060436
item.description:
Report X-2023060436

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 6th, a package was discovered during the AM sort that was wet and smelled of fuel. The outer package had some obscured markings on the outside that, after opening the package and examining the contents, do not appear to be connected with the shipment. The package contained 3 small receptacles that contained 100mL each of diesel fuel samples. One of the receptacles opened causing the entire contents to leak out to be absorbed by the box. The other 2 receptacles also appear to have cracks in them. DG Admin advised the station to hold the shipment as it appears to be undeclared since there are no markings on the outside of the package that relates to the diesel fuel inside.

item.title: Report X-2023060435
item.description:
Report X-2023060435

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 5/21/23, BNSF Portland IMF notified LARS of container FDXU 533113 arriving on the Z CHCPTL3 18A, on railcar BNSF 254590, found to be actively leaking a black liquid out of the rear doors. Unit is billed as a non hazardous load. Container FDXU 534873 was on the same railcar, loaded under the leaking unit, and has some material on the back door as well. Units were deramped and moved into the Safe Haven for containment. Upon inspection and testing by US Ecology it was determined to be a hazardous leak, observed 1 gallon of CiDecon2 Potassium Hydroxide Solution (UN1903) leaked out the rear of the unit, damaging 4, 1 gallon containers. Leak was caused by a lack of securement and heavier boxes loaded on top of the containers. US Ecology remediated everything on the rail car, ground, and bottom unit FDXU 534873.

item.title: Report X-2023060432
item.description:
Report X-2023060432

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED CALL FOR WEST SECONDARY SORT FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND DONNED P.P.E., PACKAGED WAS WET BUT NOT LEAKING FROM BOX. NO EXTERNAL MARKINGS TO DETERMINE CONTENTS. PH WAS 1. RESPONDER PROCESSED PER UNKNOWN AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS. RESPONDER SECURED CONTENTS IN SPILL TUB AND RETURNED TO PSC. PULLED SDS AND DISCOVERED PRODUCT WAS A CORROSIVE PER SECTION 14 OF DOT REGULATION. INFORMED RMP WHO CALLED HMSC WHO DETERMINED PRODUCT WAS AN UNDECLARED. SECURED AND AWAITING REVIEW BY REGULATORY COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT FOR INSTRUCTIONS.

item.title: Report X-2023060421
item.description:
Report X-2023060421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: M3 TENDER REMOVED PACKAGE FROM THE BELT AND NOTIFIED GRID SUPERVISOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED THE PSC. REPSONDER PICKED UP THE PACKAGE, CONTAINED IT IN A SPILL TRAY, AND BROUGHT IT TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. IT WAS THEN THAT THE REPSONDER ASKED IF THE LEAKING PRODUCT WOULD BE UNDECLARED. THE RESPONDER LOOKED UP THE SDS WHICH INDICATED IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN SHIPPED WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY STICKER. HMSC WAS NOTIFIED. ADG COMPLIANCE WAS SENT PHOTOS. PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023060385
item.description:
Report X-2023060385

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ODOT Hazmat inspector C. Kuenzi identified small droplets of Styrene on the threads of the PROX 23200 liquid valve. Contracted responders confirmed the release and indicated the valve was slightly loose. The valve was removed from the nozzle so new thread sealant could be applied. The valve was then reinstalled to a tool tight condition. The shipper applied for and received and OTMA for movement to destination for unloading and shop for testing of repairs.

item.title: Report X-2023060384
item.description:
Report X-2023060384

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ODOT Hazmat Inspector C. Kuenzi identified the PROX 45691 leaking vapor through the vacuum relief valve (VRV). Contract responders confirmed the release. The VRV was removed and a blind flange was made to mitigate the vapor release. All vapor dissipated and release volumes are estimates based upon responder observations. Shipper obtained an OTMA for movement of the car to destination for offloading.

item.title: Report X-2023060362
item.description:
Report X-2023060362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED AT 0444 TO A POWDER LEAKER AT SPOT 614. UPON ARRIVAL PACKAE WAS SITTING ON THE GROUND/DOCK. ONCE PACKAGE WAS OPENED, PODWER "PUFFED" OUT OF THE PACKAGE. INSIDE THE PACKAGE WAS A PLASTIC BUCKET WITH A LOCKING LID, WHICH WAS STILL LOCKED, POWDER IN THE BOTTOM OF PACKAGE, AND A VERY POTIENT ODOR/SMELL OF CHLORINE. WHILE TAKING THE BUCKET OUT OF THE PACKAGE, NOTICED A DIAMOND HAZARD 5.1 OXIDER LABEL PRINTED ON THE BUCKET. NOTIFIED RMP WE NEED TO CALL UPS HMSC AND FOLLOWED INSTRUCTIONS.

item.title: Report X-2023060360
item.description:
Report X-2023060360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO LEAKING PACKAGE AT THE UNLOAD DOOR 11, RESPONDER BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER. THERE WERE NO EXTERNAL MARKINGS , SHIPPING PAPERS, INVOICE OR DIAMOND HAZARDOUS LABELS ON OUTSIDE OF BOX, INSIDE THE BOX THERE WAS A BOX OF OXIDIZING SOLID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. CLASS 5.1 PG 3 AND ONE AEROSOL MOUSSE LEAKING LIQUID FROM CAP. ON THESE CONTAINERS THERE WERE HAZARD PICTOGRAMS. RMP FOUND SDS FOR BOTH PRODUCTS AND CALLED HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER FOR ADG RELEASE ADG HOLD.

item.description:
Report X-2023060026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE WET PACKAGE WAS RESPONDED TO BY RESPONDER. WHEN THE PACKAGE WAS OPENED IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT EACH OF THE FOUR 1-GALLON BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE (ZEP ACIDIC TOILET BOWL CLEANER) HAD ALSO LEAKED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID DUE TO LOSE LIDS. THIS LEFT DRY LIQUID RESIDUE ON THE BOTTLES AND INNER WALLS OF THE PACKAGE. RMP WAS NOTIFIED OF THE INCIDENT. ALL MERCHANDISE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP AS A LIQUID.

item.title: Report X-2023051427
item.description:
Report X-2023051427

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 5/16/23, BNSF Portland IMF notified LARS of destination unit RDWY 140990 (billed LTL HAZ, UN 1760, Combustible Liquid) which was observed to be leaking a liquid substance during the de ramping process. Upon inspection US Ecology observed a standard LTL shipment with multiple differentiating pieces of cargo unsecured at different heights. The unit was double stacked with very heavy cargo on top plastic palletized HAZ containers, while in transit the cargo shifted, allowing the plastic containers to be crushed causing the leak. All leaking containers leaked through the cap when squeezed, no holes where observed.

item.title: Report E-2023050690
item.description:
Report E-2023050690

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 11, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of nitric acid were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel deployed neutralizing agent and granular absorbents to the impacted areas. The crew then utilized hand tools to collect all UN2031 impacted material into four (4) 55-gallon drums and three (3) drum liners for disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE PROCESS, NOTIFIED RMP SUSPECTED UNDECLARED, RMP CALLED HMSC TO VERIFY UNDECLARED CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S., INSTRUCTED TO TAKE PHOTOS AND SEND TO ADG COMPLIANCE. RESPONDER HOLDING PACKAGE UNTIL RELEASE RECEIVED.

item.title: Report X-2023051406
item.description:
Report X-2023051406

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS RESPONDED TO BY RESPONDER, INSIDE TRAILER. AFTER THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING, IT WAS DISCOVERED VIA THE MERCHANDISE SDS THAT THE PACKAGE MAY BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT (ETHANOL, SOLUTIONS, UN1170, 3, II). RMP WAS NOTIFIED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS SUSPECTED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT, AND RESPONDER CONTACTED THE HMSC TO REPORT THE INCIDENT. HELD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE.

item.title: Report E-2023050244
item.description:
Report E-2023050244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 5, 2023, at 1435 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Troutdale, Oregon regarding the release of approximately 1 cup of VEX244-506C Vinyl Ester Resin (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon drum. The release was reportedly due to a forklift puncture. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 5-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
